Gas Balanceing LanguageHave you had any luck obtaining gas balancing language I need to know as soon as possible Thanks Mathew
Gas Balanceing LanguageHave you had any luck obtaining gas balancing language I need to know as soon as possible Thanks Mathew

Fort Pierce Lateral Cc John If a message was relayed to you that I said you had promised that the Fort Pierce lateral would be included in the Phase VI expansion I want to apologize for this misunderstanding I am fully aware that you have told me from the very beginning that having FGT pay for the cost of the lateral would be a push I was not implying nor did I ever intend to imply that you had ever promised getting this included in Phase VI or under FGTs blanket I have always known it would take some work and hope that this misinformation has not caused you undo grief Thank you for your understanding Mathew Gimble

Fort Pierce Pipeline Requirements Cc Ruth Welcome to the Fort Pierce Repowering Project aka FPRP now that John has become a traitor err trader The following list contains the latest and greatest natural gas needs for this project if anyone copied notices any discrepancies with my information I need to know yesterday that soon Pressure Requirements per the Mitsubishi F technical specs required pressure at the inlet is psi however this does not include losses Therefore the required pressure off of FGTs mainline needs to be psi Hourly Gas Requirements even though we have reviewed various turbine configurations the amount of hourly gas needed for this project has managed to hover around mmbtuhr using hourday run cycles Looping vs Lateral we are willing to defer to FGTs recommendation provided that a single meter configuration be used as opposed to a dual configuration Timing plans are for the plant to be running in a simplecycle configuration by June and a combinedcycle configuration by Sep Therefore we will need pipeline construction completed by Apr for startup and testing Phase VI Strategy the plan has been to either get this construction rolled into the Phase VI expansion it would be the first piece of Phase VI initiated in order to meet our time deadline or to have the construction covered by FGTs blanket for normal construction FGT Deadline It is my understanding that FGT needs to finalize the Phase VI plans by April That is everything that comes to mind at this time If you or anyone has any comments changes questions or interesting anecdotes let me know Thanks Mathew

Updated Timetableis an updated Timetable detailing the critical path issues of the Fort Pierce Repowering Project Specifically note items scheduled for completion during the next two weeks such as InternalExternal review and execution of the Land Lease Option Ground Lease and Project Development Agreement Preparation of an EPC contract Site visit to an existing enclosed FA and HRSG Coyote Springs appears to be the best option Review and prepare applications for an air permit an ERP if necessary special use permit waste water permit and interconnect request Let me know of ANY conflicts concerns or adjustments associated with the attached Thanks again for your help Mathew

Re FPRP Proforma Performance InputReview M Today PM AC CForwarded by Mathew GimbleHOUECT on AM From Mathew Gimble on AM To Darrell NRON cc David nronXGate Mike nronXGate Jennifer nronXGate Jeffrey CT Bruce GoldenENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject Re FPRP Proforma Performance InputReview M Today PM AC C Darrell There still appears to be some confusion regarding the inclusion of FPUAs ST into the deal The heat rate of the ST should not be included in the overall plant heat rate neither gross nor net The heat rate of the facility should include the GT and FPUAs and STs Duct firing needs to be determined and calculated on a standalone basis Bottom line whether FPUA or FPRP uses to generate power the heat rate associated wi th is the duct fired heat rate I have been anticipating results to look something like the following Combined Cycle HHV heat rate based on MW MW D MW using MMBtuhr FPUA HHV heat rate on MW D MMBtuhr FPRP Combined Cycle HHV MMBtuhr MMBtuhr D MMBtuhr for MW D heat rate Duct Firing HHV heat rate on MW D MMBtuhr should equal th e actual amount of additional gas needed to duct fire Let me know if you have any questions Thanks Mathew Darrell NRON AM To Mathew CT Ron CT Jennifer nronXGate cc Jeffrey CT Bruce GoldenENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Mike nronXGate Sandra EECC RodriguezENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject FPRP Proforma Performance InputReview M Today PM AC C Id like to set up meeting to review performance inputs to proforma today at PM AC C Jennifer please coordinate with ENA participants and with Sandra R to ensure we have the essential folks available Updated Proforma Input Still Preliminary We worked with CMI much of last week to revise HRSG configuration to accommodate addition of ST This is turning out to be moderate change to design potential costschedule impacts still under assessment continuingshould finalize this week Also updated assessment of aux loads increased split to GT resulting in reduced net output Output D D MW net due to higher GT aux loads HR Plantnet D HHVLHV increased due to impact of ST HR GTgross D HHVLHV Degradation See attached curves this is the best currently available degradation data Its a SiemanWestinghouse curve still trying to get M HI data Typically either apply curves or use flat degradation as alternative Needs to be coordinated with Operatingmaintenance plan Ill be working with engineering personnel to firm up as much as possible a nd be ready for meeting this afternoon thxdgs

Information Request Cc Guys The information that yall had requested in the meeting does not contain any output or heat balancing information that you will need to assist in the sizing of the lateral Jennifer and I provided Fred Mitro information that contained capital cost property taxes and some other modeling assumptions We did not give him any update or indication on where the output and heat rate numbers would be I have asked Jennifer to hold off sending you what was requested after todays meeting because it is omitting the concrete information that you really need As soon as we receive new output and heat rate information I will forward it directly If for some reason you need capital costs and property tax information let me know Thanks Mathew

Re Fuel Oil Vanadium SpecCharlespst I dont even like thinking about the last time I had my vanadium checked From V Charles nronXgate on PM To Matthew TezykENRON nronDevelopment Mike nronXgate cc Mark nronXgate Ed nronXgate Mathew CT David nronXgate Subject Fuel Oil Vanadium Spec As I previously shared the result for vandium in the lowsulfer diesel fuel oil came back at ppm versus the spec of ppm I just talked to the lab supervisor at Saybolt whom performed the analysis and according to him there is no practical way of measuring the vanadium content more precisely than within onetenth of a ppm The only way he knows of is to use a NMR nuclear magnetic resonance machine that NASA uses to analyze rocket fuel He is not sure whether or not the government would allow use of such a machine but estimates that if they did allow it could cost upwards of Please let me know if we should pursue this matter any further Thanks Charlie
Ft Pierce Gas Assumptions Cc discussion today see attached Note the heat rate is moving around a bit Mathew

Re FPRP Proforma Performance InputReview M Today PM AC CForwarded by Mathew GimbleHOUECT on AM From Mathew Gimble on AM To Darrell NRON cc David nronXGate Mike nronXGate Jennifer nronXGate Jeffrey CT Bruce GoldenENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject Re FPRP Proforma Performance InputReview M Today PM AC C Darrell There still appears to be some confusion regarding the inclusion of FPUAs ST into the deal The heat rate of the ST should not be included in the overall plant heat rate neither gross nor net The heat rate of the facility should include the GT and FPUAs and STs Duct firing needs to be determined and calculated on a standalone basis Bottom line whether FPUA or FPRP uses to generate power the heat rate associated wi th is the duct fired heat rate I have been anticipating results to look something like the following Combined Cycle HHV heat rate based on MW MW D MW using MMBtuhr FPUA HHV heat rate on MW D MMBtuhr FPRP Combined Cycle HHV MMBtuhr MMBtuhr D MMBtuhr for MW D heat rate Duct Firing HHV heat rate on MW D MMBtuhr should equal th e actual amount of additional gas needed to duct fire Let me know if you have any questions Thanks Mathew Darrell NRON AM To Mathew CT Ron CT Jennifer nronXGate cc Jeffrey CT Bruce GoldenENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Mike nronXGate Sandra EECC RodriguezENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject FPRP Proforma Performance InputReview M Today PM AC C Id like to set up meeting to review performance inputs to proforma today at PM AC C Jennifer please coordinate with ENA participants and with Sandra R to ensure we have the essential folks available Updated Proforma Input Still Preliminary We worked with CMI much of last week to revise HRSG configuration to accommodate addition of ST This is turning out to be moderate change to design potential costschedule impacts still under assessment continuingshould finalize this week Also updated assessment of aux loads increased split to GT resulting in reduced net output Output D D MW net due to higher GT aux loads HR Plantnet D HHVLHV increased due to impact of ST HR GTgross D HHVLHV Degradation See attached curves this is the best currently available degradation data Its a SiemanWestinghouse curve still trying to get M HI data Typically either apply curves or use flat degradation as alternative Needs to be coordinated with Operatingmaintenance plan Ill be working with engineering personnel to firm up as much as possible a nd be ready for meeting this afternoon thxdgs

Information Request Cc Guys The information that yall had requested in the meeting does not contain any output or heat balancing information that you will need to assist in the sizing of the lateral Jennifer and I provided Fred Mitro information that contained capital cost property taxes and some other modeling assumptions We did not give him any update or indication on where the output and heat rate numbers would be I have asked Jennifer to hold off sending you what was requested after todays meeting because it is omitting the concrete information that you really need As soon as we receive new output and heat rate information I will forward it directly If for some reason you need capital costs and property tax information let me know Thanks Mathew

FMPA Oil Invoice Cc PST Mark and Charlie FMPA is ready to bill us for the oil but they have a couple of questions They want to know whom and where do they send the invoice and what should they reference Email your response or any questions to Steve McElhaney at FMPA In case I forgot to tell yall I am going on vacation right now through Ill have my cell phone and will check voicemails periodically Thanks again for your help and if I miss you have a great Fourth Mathew
